description: Describes one or more transit gateways. By default, all transit gateways are described. Alternatively, you can filter the results.

parameters.name: TransitGatewayIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the transit gateways. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. The possible values are: options.propagation-default-route-table-id - The ID of the default propagation route table. options.amazon-side-asn - The private ASN for the Amazon side of a BGP session. options.association-default-route-table-id - The ID of the default association route table. options.auto-accept-shared-attachments - Indicates whether there is automatic acceptance of attachment requests ( enable | disable). options.default-route-table-association - Indicates whether resource attachments are automatically associated with the default association route table ( enable | disable). options.default-route-table-propagation - Indicates whether resource attachments automatically propagate routes to the default propagation route table ( enable | disable). options.dns-support - Indicates whether DNS support is enabled ( enable | disable). options.vpn-ecmp-support - Indicates whether Equal Cost Multipath Protocol support is enabled ( enable | disable). owner-id - The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the transit gateway. state - The state of the transit gateway ( available | deleted | deleting | modifying | pending). transit-gateway-id - The ID of the transit gateway. tag-key ``- The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key ``Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: TransitGateways
nested_items.description: Information about the transit gateways.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The creation time.

nested_items.name: AmazonSideAsn
nested_items.description: A private Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of a BGP session. The range is 64512 to 65534 for 16-bit ASNs and 4200000000 to 4294967294 for 32-bit ASNs.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayCidrBlocks
nested_items.description: The transit gateway CIDR blocks.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AutoAcceptSharedAttachments
nested_items.description: Indicates whether attachment requests are automatically accepted.

nested_items.name: DefaultRouteTableAssociation
nested_items.description: Indicates whether resource attachments are automatically associated with the default association route table. Enabled by default. If defaultRouteTableAssociation is set to enable, Amazon Web Services Transit Gateway will create the default transit gateway route table.

nested_items.name: AssociationDefaultRouteTableId
nested_items.description: The ID of the default association route table.

nested_items.name: DefaultRouteTablePropagation
nested_items.description: Indicates whether resource attachments automatically propagate routes to the default propagation route table. Enabled by default. If defaultRouteTablePropagation is set to enable, Amazon Web Services Transit Gateway will create the default transit gateway route table.

nested_items.name: PropagationDefaultRouteTableId
nested_items.description: The ID of the default propagation route table.

nested_items.name: VpnEcmpSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Equal Cost Multipath Protocol support is enabled.

nested_items.name: DnsSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether DNS support is enabled.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupReferencingSupport
nested_items.description: Enables you to reference a security group across VPCs attached to a transit gateway to simplify security group management.

nested_items.name: MulticastSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether multicast is enabled on the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags for the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
